department: Public Works and Government Services Canada
full_summary:
**Title:** CCGS Teather Dry-Docking Refit

**Reference Number:** PW_HAL_308_11577

**Notice Type:** Request for Proposal

**Trade Agreement:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

**Tender Status:** Expired

**Procurement Category:** SRVTGD (Vessel Refit/Upgrade)

**Description:**
The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada requires the dry-docking refit of the CCGS Corporal Teather. This project is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and is open to all interested suppliers.

**Technical Requirements:**
A complete technical data package is available upon request to the Contracting Authority. The CCGS Teather does not have an ice class, and the procurement is geographically limited to bidders outside the areas expected to contain ice in the St. Lawrence Seaway, the Gulf of St. Lawrence, the Northumberland Strait, Eastern Labrador, and Northern Newfoundland.

**Work Period:**
The project duration is from November 7, 2022, to December 30, 2022.

**Submission Requirements:**
Suppliers can submit bids electronically using the Canada Post epost Connect application or in hard copy. The mail room at 1713 Bedford Row has reduced hours due to COVID-19 restrictions.

**Inquiries:**
All technical or contractual inquiries should be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority, Rachelle LaBrash, at least 5 calendar days prior to the closing date.

**Evaluation Criteria:**
The selection criteria are Lowest/Lower Bid.

**Delivery Location:** The bidders will be required to deliver the vessel at the contracted location.

**Contact Information:**
Rachelle LaBrash
Contracting Authority
Email: [rachelle.labrash@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca](mailto:rachelle.labrash@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca)
Phone: (902) 401-2080
Fax: (902) 496-5016

**Tender Documents:**
The tender documents are available on the Buyandsell.gc.ca procurement data website. Please note that addenda, if issued, will also be available on the same website.

**Trade Agreements:**
The project is subject to exemptions from various trade agreements, including the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) and the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP). The Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement does not apply. The requirement
